tables.table_schema:
CREATE TABLE test_results (
  result_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
  site_id INT,
  test_date DATE NOT NULL,
  test_type VARCHAR(30) NOT NULL,
  result DECIMAL(10, 2) NOT NULL,
  FOREIGN KEY (site_id) REFERENCES water_quality_testing_sites(site_id)
);

CREATE TABLE water_quality_tests (
   test_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
   test_date DATE NOT NULL,
   test_result VARCHAR(20) NOT NULL,
   site_id INT,
   FOREIGN KEY (site_id) REFERENCES water_quality_sites(site_id)
);

CREATE TABLE WaterTestingResults (
  testing_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
  testing_date DATE,
  testing_site VARCHAR(255),
  contaminant_type VARCHAR(50),
  contaminant_level FLOAT
)},{

CREATE TABLE WaterQualityTestingSites (
    site_id INT NOT NULL,
    site_name VARCHAR(255) NOT NULL,
    site_location VARCHAR(255) NOT NULL,
    PRIMARY KEY (site_id)
)

CREATE TABLE TestResults (
    result_id INT NOT NULL,
    site_id INT NOT NULL,
    testing_date DATE NOT NULL,
    tested_parameter VARCHAR(255) NOT NULL,
    test_result FLOAT NOT NULL,
    PRIMARY KEY (result_id),
    CONSTRAINT fk_site_id FOREIGN KEY (site_id) REFERENCES WaterQualityTestingSites(site_id)
)

CREATE TABLE ParameterLimits (
    parameter_id INT NOT NULL,
    parameter_name VARCHAR(255) NOT NULL,
    limit_value FLOAT NOT NULL,
    PRIMARY KEY (parameter_id)
)

CREATE TABLE TestLimits (
    result_id INT NOT NULL,
    parameter_id INT NOT NULL,
    result_value FLOAT NOT NULL,
    result_status VARCHAR(255) NOT NULL,
    PRIMARY KEY (result_id, parameter_id),
    CONSTRAINT fk_result_id FOREIGN KEY (result_id) REFERENCES TestResults(result_id),
    CONSTRAINT fk_parameter_id FOREIGN KEY (parameter_id) REFERENCES ParameterLimits(parameter_id)
)

CREATE TABLE Testers (
    tester_id INT NOT NULL,
    tester_name VARCHAR(255) NOT NULL,
    tester_email VARCHAR(255) NOT NULL,
    PRIMARY KEY (tester_id)
)
